attributes.action: Stop the CAZ charge in Bradford the clean air zone is an entrapment zone
attributes.additional_details:
In this era of high energy prices & inflation the number of chargeable vehicles entering bradford will only add to causing higher prices in an already run down city
We urge the government to insist that Bradford Council reassess this unreasonable charge as other cities in the North of England have already done, for example Leeds & Manchester.
Charging to enter a clean air zone does not clean the air, but allowing free movement of traffic does
attributes.background: Stop the charge to enter clean air zone, there isn't any alternative routes to avoid the entrapment charge poor signage prior to entering the areas, poor road infrastructure forcing vehicles into the entrapment zone

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local clean air zones are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266
